A log breaks in front of the cliff.
(Xuetang Xing).
"He snatched the drum and mixed it with a flag to examine the saṃgha.
He then exchanged the black soybeans for his two eyes.
In the past, I was once bitterly buffeted by snow and frost.
He was startled even when he saw the falling of the poplar flower.
(General Nuns Without Attachment).
"He took the first hammer from Sumeru.
How could I have a bronze head and an iron forehead?
Salt, plum, oars, and rain.
If it wasn't this person, who else would it be?'
(Fuam Feng).
Jiham once trained as a potter.
He had no choice but to flee as things changed.
He was shown to someone gazing from a high building.
Their keen eyes can discern the finest detail in the autumn.
(Potala Yug).
[Added] Chen Shangshu asked Muzhou.
"What sūtra does he read?
He said.
"The Diamond Sutra.
The minister said.
"It was translated during the six dynasties.
How many dynasties does the teacher see?
The governor picked it up and said.
"All existent things are like dreams, illusions, bubbles, and shadows.
They are like dreams, illusions, bubbles, and shadows.'
He spoke a verse, saying.
"This translation from the sixth dynasty has been handed down as marvelous.
At the end, they hadn't realized the then-current trick.
They must believe in the old phoenix on the branch.
When spring comes, they'll turn it into a yellow-billed warbling bird.
(Shōtō rōben).

source_sentence: 禪宗頌古聯珠通集卷第二十六
translation: Chanzong chanson gu lianzhu tongji vol. 26
